job_profile_jp0.text: The last thing a business needs is a conformity to a limited world view, it needs the greatest diversity to assure the greatest leverage and clientbase match.  So we do not want you to answer this survey trying to guess the right answer, because the only right answer IS your own natural way, and if you don’t fill your niche, someone else might, and then you’d end up in the wrong role for yourself and your colleagues.  So please be truthful and honest with yourself, it’s the only way we can maximse the business performance and your takehome pay that results from globally optimising this business.  There are 10 sets of options, with your choice to rank in importance (First: most important ... Last: least important) ok?

ancestors_anc1a.text: Make sure you have pen/postits available.   Describe the situation fully.

ancestors_anc1b.text: When you think of your mother, whereabouts do you see her?   how far from your body, in which direction?

ancestors_anc1c.text: Place a postit in your present position, and then place another one in her space.

ancestors_anc1d.text: What does your mother know about this?

ancestors_anc2b.text: Place a postit in that position.

ancestors_anc2c.text: What does she know about this?

ancestors_anc3a.text: Return to your starting position.  When you think of your father, whereabouts do you see him?   how far from your body, in which direction?

ancestors_anc3b.text: Place another postit in his space.

ancestors_anc3c.text: What does your father know about this?

ancestors_anc4b.text: Place a postit in that position.

ancestors_anc4c.text: What does he know about this?

ancestors_anc5.text: and what do your ancestors have to say to you now?

relating_relB.text: Choose a person with whom you had a relationship, in the past (a completed relationship).

relating_relP.text: Choose a customer or other business with whom you had a relationship, in the past (a completed relationship).

relating_rel1a.text: What did you want from the relationship before it started?

relating_rel1b.text: What did they want from the relationship before it started?

relating_rel1c.text: What were your needs, and what were their needs?

relating_rel2a.text: As they become aware of you, how are they relating to you, as they become aware of you?

relating_rel2b.text: As you become aware of them, how are you relating to them, as you become aware of them?

relating_rel2d.text: And as that is happening, what is happening, as that is happening?

relating_rel3a.text: As time goes by, how do they change how they relate to you?

relating_rel3b.text: As time goes by, how do you change how you relate to them?

relating_rel3c.text: How else do you and they change, as time goes by?

relating_rel4a.text: What did they do to fine-tune the relationship into its habitual pattern?

relating_rel4b.text: What did you do to fine-tune the relationship into its habitual pattern?

relating_rel4c.text: How did it stabilise into the form that lasted longest?

relating_rel5a.text: How have they been serving you through the relationship?

relating_rel5b.text: What were you getting from it?

relating_rel5c.text: How were you serving them through it?

relating_rel5d.text: What were they getting from it?

relating_rel6a.text: What did you each do or not do to keep it working or to improve it?

relating_rel7a.text: What did they do or not do, that contributed to the ending?

relating_rel7b.text: What did you do or not do that contributed to the ending?

relating_rel7c.text: What kind of relationship was it?

relating_rel7d.text: IS there anything incomplete about this relationship?

relating_rel7e.text: What did you get from it?

relating_rel7f.text: What did they get from it?

relating_rel8a.text: Review the pattern of this relationship.  Going back over the pattern:

relating_rel8b.text: What did you really want, at the beginning?

relating_rel8d.text: What did you assume, but not state nor ask for, at the beginning?

relating_rel8e.text: In response, how did you change?

relating_rel8f.text: How did you develop or grow?

relating_rel9.text: Now choose a person who is presently in your life?

relating_rel10.text: Knowing the answers above, where are you now in your relationship?

relating_rel11.text: What, if anything, would you like to do differently now?

story_insight_sti1a.text: What is THEIR favourite film or book or story?  (Write down your first though, however ridiculous.)

story_insight_sti1b.text: Write the name of each character on a different post-it.

story_insight_sti1c.text: Place each postit in a different space   (In a large enough space for you to be able to visit each one, physically.)

story_insight_sti1d.text: Identify the role of each character

story_insight_sti1e.text: Go to the space of each character in turn, to understand their role.

story_insight_sti1f.text: Now identify where you are in the story, which scene?

story_insight_sti1g.text: Which character do THEY most identify with?

deint_de1a.text: Write down (on paper) or represent everything and anything; every belief, every common thing you say, everything; your life story.   Keep on writing; have others notice what you say to them, and add these sentences.   finished?

deint_de1b.text: Cut each statement onto its own piece of paper.  Then place together the sentences that come from the same pronoun.

deint_de1c.text: Add any more statements that go with each group, and place into their own, new group any statements that fit none of the groups.

deint_de1e.text: Sort and identity the sources and roots of each group, until you are clear on how each of these came to you in the first instance.

deint_de1f.text: And, what do you know now?

installing_ins1.text: Become aware of the over-sensitivity that you wish to address.  Notice where in your body you feel it, and notice where you can visualise its strength.  Reach out and touch that place, and feel the control.  Take it in the wrong direction first - stronger, just a little, and then return it to the first position.  Then reduce the strength to the level you desire.  It really is as simple as a volume control knob, and works for tinitus, emotional fields, and any body function, even telepathy, subject to unresolved structures.

poetry_ep1.text: A wiggle to settle in, and then she felt right; this was the place, for her issue to face.

poetry_ep2.text: What lost knowing could Hiyuki weather, what tiny a flower a violet heather?

poetry_ep3.text: And within the treasure what does she find, a clue to the next thought she untwined.

poetry_ep4a.text: 'The (background) has knowledge, for sure to be mined.'

poetry_ep4b.text: What wears the rock sitting in glade, how does it sit, in sun or shade?

poetry_ep4c.text: What know the flowers and the trees, of light and dark and leaves?

poetry_ep4d.text: What know the birds and the bees, messengers to please?

poetry_ep4e.text: What knows the garden, hedges and all, a paradise set within a wall?

poetry_ep4f.text: What kind of world sets the stone, within the paradise not so alone?

poetry_ep4g.text: And what of a gardener, designed with care, what knows she of gardening fair?

poetry_ep5.text: And what then did she know, a force in full flow?

poetry_ep6.text: And where then to be in the garden made free?

poetry_ep7.text: Deep in her core, it grows ever more.       THE END

clean_worlds_cw1.text: Write down you mission in life, as verbosely as you wish. Explore the etymology of key words.

clean_worlds_cw2.text: Write down every single important moment in your life from birth to now, on separate postits .

compensating_co1.text: Compensating: Compensation occurs when someone takes up one behaviour because one cannot accomplish another behaviour.    Think of something as simple as joining an online dating site because one has not met the desired life partner in present life activity, or hiring a gardener because one has no time to do that job oneself.  Notice how some people around you are doing one thing instead of another. Notice how the entire monetary world is in fact a compensation culture - literally to the word.  You might be working only because you cannot live the lifestyle without the income! How many compensations might you have?  They can be useful or debilitating, keep the useful ones!!!

denying_den1.text: Denying: An ego defence mechanism that operates unconsciously to resolve emotional conflict, and to reduce anxiety by refusing to perceive the more unpleasant aspects of external reality;  Denying fact: This form of denial is where someone avoids a fact by lying. This lying can take the form of an outright falsehood (commission), leaving out certain details in order to tailor a story (omission), or by falsely agreeing to something (assent, also referred to as 'yes-ing' behaviour). Someone who is in denial of fact is typically using lies in order to avoid facts that they think may be potentially painful to themselves or others.  Denying responsibility: This form of denial involves avoiding personal responsibility by blaming, minimizing or justifying. Blaming is a direct statement shifting culpability and may overlap with denial of fact. Minimizing is an attempt to make the effects or results of an action appear to be less harmful than they may actually be. Justifying is when someone takes a choice and attempts to make that choice look okay due to their perception of what is 'right' in a situation. Someone using denial of responsibility is usually attempting to avoid potential harm or pain by shifting attention away from themselves.  Denying impact: Denial of impact involves a person avoiding thinking about or understanding the harms their behaviour have caused to themselves or others. By doing this, that person is able to avoid feeling a sense of guilt and it can prevent that person from developing remorse or empathy for others. Denial of impact reduces or eliminates a sense of pain or harm from poor decisions.  Denying awareness: This type of denial is best discussed by looking at the concept of state dependent learning. People using this type of denial will avoid pain and harm by stating they were in a different state of awareness (such as alcohol or drug intoxication or on occasion mental health related). This type of denial often overlaps with denial of responsibility.  Denying cycle: Many who use this type of denial will say things such as, 'it just happened.' Denial of cycle is where a person avoids looking at their decisions leading up to an event or does not consider their pattern of decision making and how harmful behaviour is repeated. The pain and harm being avoided by this type of denial is more of the effort needed to change the focus from a singular event to looking at preceding events. It can also serve as a way to blame or justify behaviour (see above).  Denying denying: This can be a difficult concept for many people to identify in themselves, but is a major barrier to changing hurtful behaviours. Denial of denial involves thoughts, actions and behaviours which bolster confidence that nothing needs to be changed in ones personal behaviour. This form of denial typically overlaps with all of the other forms of denial, but involves more self-delusion.  How many different things might a person deny? (e.g. responsibility, consequences, blame, truth?)

displacing_disp1.text: Displacing: An unconscious defence mechanism, whereby the mind redirects emotion from a ‘dangerous’ object to a ‘safe’ object. In psychoanalytic theory, displacement is a defence mechanism that shifts sexual or aggressive impulses to a more acceptable or less threatening target; redirecting emotion to a safer outlet; For instance, some people punch cushions when angry at friends; a college student may snap at their roommate when upset about an exam grade.  Notice how you displaced one thing for another.  How many can you find?

dissociating_diss1.text: Dissociating: Separation or postponement of a feeling that normally would accompany a situation or thought.  Freud has a very different inerpretation of this word from Holigral.  We infer dissociation as aspects out of the body or disconnected from the present self  In which situations might you do this? (How many?)

humour_hum1.text: Humouring: Refocuses attention on the somewhat comical side of the situation as to relieve negative tension; similar to comic relief.  How many situations do you defuse with humour?

idealising_ideal1.text: Idealising: Form of denial in which the object of attention is presented as 'all good' masking true negative feelings towards the other.  Who have you idealised?

identifying_ident1.text: Identifying: The unconscious modelling of one's self upon another person's behaviour.  With whom have you identified?

inverting_inv1.text: nverting: Refocusing of aggression or emotions evoked from an external force onto one's self.

intellectualising_int1.text: Intellectualising (isolating): Concentrating on the intellectual components of the situations as to distance oneself from the anxiety provoking emotions associated with these situations;  Intellectualising is a defence mechanism where reasoning is used to block confrontation with an unconscious conflict and its associated emotional stress. It involves removing one's self, emotionally, from a stressful event. Intellectualization is often accomplished through rationalization; rather than accepting reality, one may explain it away to remove one's self.  For example, suppose Jay has been brought up by a strict father, and he feels hurt and angry as a result. Although Jay may have deep feelings of hatred towards his father, when he talks about his childhood, Jay may say: 'Yes, my father was a rather firm person, I suppose I do feel some antipathy towards him even now.'  Jay intellectualizes; he chooses rational and emotionally cool words to describe experiences which are usually emotional and very painful  How many different ways could you intellectualise?

projecting_pro1.text: Projecting: Attributing to others, one’s own unacceptable or unwanted thoughts and/or emotions. Projection reduces anxiety in the way that it allows the expression of the impulse or desire without letting the ego recognise it.   Holigral has a VERY different perspective on this.  Nonetheless, how might you have done this - How many different ways?

reaction_forming_rf1.text: Reaction forming: The converting of unconscious wishes or impulses that are perceived to be dangerous into their opposites  How many different ways can you do/have you done this?

regressing_rg1.text: Regressing: The reversion to an earlier stage of development in the face of unacceptable impulses;  How many ways?

repressing_rep1.text: Repressing: The process of pulling thoughts into the unconscious and preventing painful or dangerous thoughts from entering consciousness

sublimate_su1.text: Sublimating: The refocusing of psychic energy (which Sigmund Freud believed was limited) away from negative outlets to more positive outlets. These drives which cannot find an outlet are rechanneled. In Freud’s classic theory, erotic energy is only allowed limited expression due to repression, and much of the remainder of a given group’s erotic energy is used to develop its culture and civilisation. Freud considered this defence mechanism the most productive compared to the others that he identified. Sublimation is the process of transforming libido into ‘socially useful’ achievements, mainly art. Psychoanalysts often refer to sublimation as the only truly successful defence mechanism;  How many ways?

sublimating_sp1.text: Suppressing: The conscious process of pushing thoughts into the preconscious.  How many ways?

somatising_so1.text: Somatisating: Manifestation of emotional anxiety into physical symptoms.  How many ways? (e.g. sickness)

splitting_spl1.text: Splitting: Primitive defence mechanism-when a person sees external objects or people as either 'all good' or 'all bad.'  How many ways?

substituting_su1.text: Substituting: When a person replaces one feeling or emotion for another.  How many ways?

undoing_u1.text: Undoing: A person tries to 'undo' a negative or threatening thought by their actions.  How many ways/times?

freudian_defenses_f1.text: Freudian Self Defence Systems  'Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.'  Carl Jung  The following 21 defence systems are the classical types and definitions from the work of Sigmund and Anna Freud.  Much of the text is taken from Wikipedia.  I have re-framed every Freudian defense mechanism as a transient verb to avoid fixing labelling by the very projection of measuring.  Because we do share our client’s issue at some level and with some content differences, be very careful: our content is NOT the same as their content, our empathy may be self-reflexive sympathy.   The defence mechanisms should give you plenty of ground for your own personal development.  Everyone and everything that you judge, that you think bad of, that you think well of, that you accept or not, only ever tells you about you!  There is only one of us.    1. Compensating  2. Denying  3. Displacing  4. Dissociating  5. Humouring  6. Idealising  7. Identifying  8. Intellectualising  9. Introjecting 10. Inverting 11. Projecting 12. Rationalising 13. Reaction forming 14. Regressing 15. Repressing 16. Somatisating 17. Splitting 18. Substituting 19. Sublimating 20. Suppressing 21. Undoing  Choose one ...

holigral_code_hc1.text: The Holigral Way         'An Empty Vessel Suffers Not.'  These are our principles for living life at one with the world.  They have been developed after years of thought and meditation as to the best practices to enable harmony.  Every rule has its exception - and so do these principles.   1. Cause no harm; this is just good karma for your next life, and so on.  Or cause harm and experience the consequences.  2. Clean up after yourself; this is the only serious rule.  The consequences are anti-social, and I call upon the neighbours and relevant powers to visit the karmic return.  3. Be not serious, except for the purpose of entertaining the non-serious.  Laughter is the natural response to truth.  It is also fine to be serious if you really insist.  4. Know you are perfect as you are, as is everyone else, for they are you.  So whatever you do to them, you only do to yourself, and you WILL be on the receiving end during that life when you are that other person.  This is why harmlessness pays, and good enough reason to be harmless and grateful for other people’s acts of harmlessness.  It is also fine to not be harmless and not to be perfect - there are many times and places where this serves.  5. When asked, you may accept or decline as you wish (yes to the soul, no to manipulation: use discernment).  It is also fine to not use discernment and explore the consequences.  6. Be helping to change something only when asked by someone else, because everything is already perfect. If you wish to change something, work with it; help it to do its job, and it will cease as naturally and effortlessly as possible.  It is also fine to offer to help, and to help without being asked - just don’t expect to have your help accepted - nor to receive any gratitude.  7. Be unattached to your offers being accepted.  “Shall I put the light on or not?”  “Would you like a cup of tea?”  It is okay to offer a service, but do so without attached desire, remain equanimous to the response.  It is also fine to be attached - enjoy it.  8. Never be telling anyone how to do their job or activity - unless they asked you first - else you might ruin their learning or incur their wrath.  Every single job or human activity is done by the actor for the purpose of learning about or understanding that activity; they learn by doing.  It is also fine to tell someone - enjoy the consequences.  9. Be neither judging of yourself nor of others.  There is no right or wrong; each actor has attracted the others, and the outcome perfect for all - at the soul level of perception - obviously the personality might not agree.  Paradoxically, therefore, it is fine to be judging if so required by the other actors.10. Be accepting of others as they are, and of yourself as you are; its the only way to assure inner and outer peace, but you can choose who you spend time with - you do not have to consort with anyone.  It is also fine to be non-accepting - enjoy a bit of judgement. 11. Release yourself and others from your interpretations of your perceptions.  You can only see yourself in others.  It is an act of harm to hold even an interpreted perception of another being unless it has been requested.  Notice maybe, but let it pass.  It is also fine to not release - hold on and experience it. 12. Be in the here and now.  When mind arises, let it do its job and return to peace.  Let emotions inform right action and flow out to completion.  It’s also fine to be other than in the here and now - dream of the future and re-think the past. 13. Listen as follows: when a person says “I” without contrivance they are speaking for you - take note; and when a person says “you”, do not listen - for they are projecting.  The same goes for you: listen when you say “you” to another person - this is your projection.  This guideline must NOT become manipulated.  Never substitute your natural pronouns usage - own any desire to do so and own any mis-uses and clean them up with the processes, please. 14. Defend the weak against the powerful.  Assume the powerful are corrupt and the weak innocent - until proven otherwise.  Help the weak to help themselves.  It is also fine not to follow the way.  But there are consequences.  For an easy life, follow the way; for more challenge, do not.  This code is what delegates may expect of our facilitators, but we do not expect delegates to follow this code.  Choose an aspect to consider.

maat_maat2.text: Search your life for how many ways you might have contravened this declaration - we ALL have.  Be thorough, because Ma'At does not allow anyone with a heart heavier than a feather to pass into the Afterlife

kings_code_kc1.text: The King's Code   1.Peace is offered to all those who will accept it.  The peace of the gods, returned. 1a. Accept the peace and feel it spread within you.  1b. Offer this peace to others, and credit the source.   2. Cause no harm 2a. see the 42 aspects of the code of Ma'At for examples - below. 2b. to others or to yourself - and especially do not justify the causing of harm.   3. Clean up after yourself 3a. also see the code of Ma’At for what this means (do not pollute the land or the water or the air, do not litter, ...) 3b. This means businesses, governments, armies, people, services and so on.   4. The poor are assumed innocent and the powerful assumed corrupt; 4a. the burden of proof is always on the more powerful party; 4b. if one party is not significantly more powerful then both are saddled with the burden of proof.   5. Co-operate in partnerships and heterarchies 5a. leaders are stewards, who recognise they are the least worthy, in service to their people 5b. buy from a partnership in preference to a company 5c. charging interest is immoral   6. Do not worship the gods, nor beg them for forgiveness; thank them instead 6a. instead: make amends to injured parties, and/or to people who have suffered such abuses as you have perpetrated. 6b. walk your talk; the gods will judge your actions not your words and forgive AFTER atonement. 6c. pray altruistically to them for the betterment of the world - for others; pray not for yourself.   7. No more victim: you are responsible, you have a conscience: use it. 7a. notice your excuses, complaints, rationalisations, justifications, arguments and giving-away of power to others: and stop doing these things. 7b. and no more persecuting; make amends and stop.   8. We are all one, part of the ALL; both individual and collective. 8a. The world is now a multiplicity, not a duality; forget good and evil. 8b. Every being has a unique role; value it.   9. Honour your word.  Speak the truth.  If you are unsure, do not commit; once you do say ‘yes’ or ‘no’, follow it through. 9a. Minimise assumptions about others, and about what others say to/about you - take nothing personally. 9b. Publish and follow your code.  Live your life by it.  Choose one of these

maat_maat1.text: MA’AT: THE 42 DECLARATIONS OF PURITY  The following principles of Ma’at are the source of the ten commandments, and they serve as well now as 4000 years ago   1. I have not killed, nor bid anyone kill.  2. I have not committed adultery or rape.  3. I have not avenged myself nor burned with rage.  4. I have not caused terror.  5. I have not assaulted anyone nor caused anyone pain.  6. I have not caused misery.  7. I have not done any harm to man or to animals.  8. I have not caused the shedding of tears.  9. I have not wronged the people nor bear them any evil intent. 10. I have not stolen nor taken that which does not belong to me. 11. I have not taken more than my fair share [of food, money, land, possessions]. 12. I have not damaged the crops, the fields, or the trees. 13. I have not deprived anyone of what is rightfully theirs. 14. I have not borne false witness, nor supported false allegations. 15. I have not lied, nor spoken falsely to the hurt of another. 16. I have not used fiery words nor stirred up any strife. 17. I have not spoken nor acted deceitfully to the hurt of another. 18. I have not spoken scornfully against others. 19. I have not eavesdropped. 20. I have not ignored the truth or words of righteousness. 21. I have not judged anyone hastily or harshly. 22. I have not disrespected sacred places [all places are sacred]. 23. I have caused no wrong to be done to any workers or prisoners [to those in my power or under my influence]. 24. I have not been angry without good reason. 25. I have not hindered the flow of running water. 26. I have not wasted the running water. 27. I have not polluted the water or the land. 28. I have not taken God's name in vain [nor anyone else’s]. 29. I have not despised nor angered the gods [not anyone/anything else]. 30. I have not stolen from god [nor from anyone else]. 31. I have not given excessive offerings, nor less than what is due [tax]. 32. I have not coveted my neighbour's goods. 33. I have not stolen from nor disrespect the dead [nor anyone else]. 34. I have remembered and observed the appointed holy days. 35. I have not held back the offerings due to the gods [nor tax]. 36. I have not interfered with sacred rites. 37. I have not slaughtered with evil intent any sacred animals [all animal are sacred]. 38. I have not acted with guile or insolence. 39. I have not been unduly proud nor acted with arrogance. 40. I have not magnified my condition beyond what is appropriate. 41. I have done no less than my daily obligations require. 42. I have obeyed the law and committed no treason.   Choose one of these

the_code_code1.text: the codes: 1. The Holigral Code, 2. The King's Code, 3. Ma'At   Choose 1,2 or 3.

general_1.text: On which word do you place most emphasis?   (type in a number from 1 to 7 please)   ( ... or ...  0  if actually none has the emphasis)

consulting_c1g.text: 7. How are you progressing with your vision?

distance_1a.text: Make a list of every want, wish, desire, urge, need that you have.   When done, number them, and type in how many.

distance_1b.text: Now make a list of every 'don't-want' that you have.   When done, number them, and type in how many.

retreat_ret2.text: choose 1. the story of your life, or 2. the remaining big issue(s)

main_main2.text: would you like the conversation saved? (y/n)

main_main1.text: Hello, and welcome to the Holigral Method.  It will work, tho' sometimes you have to go round the loop a few times, and it may take some time, or use unusual or iterative/recursive questioning.  Sometimes a question might seem odd, just answer it anyway.  Sometimes the choice of process may seem odd.  The story of 'the drunk looking for the keys under the lamp post' applies...  Ground Rules: 1. NOT suitable for sociopaths, nor people undergoing psychotherapy, nor anyone taking/using psychoactive drugs. 2. It only asks questions,  whatever is discovered, and the consequences are entirely the user's responsibility. 3. Tell the truth, if you lie or deceive, of course the process won't work.  4. This is copyright material, belonging to The Holigral Partnership, please respect the inventor.  TYPE IN 'QUIT' to exit at any time to also be able to save the transcript.  And, type in in '?' for help.  These are the starting options:  0: Address my whole life. 1: A Personal Issue. 2: The Holigral Distance Programme. 3: Learning. 4: Reading the Matrix. 5: A Business Issue 6: Awakening / Spiritual Development 7: Cultural Change 8: Re-Start Prior Session   Please type in the number of your choice:
